ygData.subject: Re: Wooly Mammoths
ygData.msgSnippet: Not a bad idea. However, we are playing around the world, and so around the clock. Still, if you have a good alt, you could park your ranger in Everfrost and
ygData.messageBody:
Not a bad idea. However, we are playing around the world, and so
around the clock. Still, if you have a good alt, you could park your
ranger in Everfrost and hunt when it is good. When it is not so good
you can camp the ranger and switch to your alt.

I recommend finding a high point overlooking the frozen river. You
can see the mammoths coming and intercept. You can often see if it
has been grabbed by another player or group as well, allowing you to
focus on another target.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "J. Smythe" <lgumaer@h...> wrote:
> I guess a ranger could go there in the middle of the night.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jeff Gaudry
> To: EverQuest@y...
> Sent: Friday, April 26, 2002 3:22 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Wooly Mammoths
>
>
> >Over eight pp per tusk for my druid halfling selling
> >at home in Rivervale. Pretty profitable and exp as
> >well. Glad I moved to Everfrost.
>
> Best cash in the game at that level range, the only
> snag is that it only takes two people with track to
> comfortably kill the Mammoths as fast as they pop.
> Three and the zone is over hunted. Thus I don't
> recommend going there to anyone but druids. Track is
> absolutely essential or you just plain won't get any
> mobs, and even more important is the ability to leave
> and go hunt in SK or somewhere else when the zone is
> overcrowded.
>
>
>
